intro: Waltheria saundersiae, commonly known as the Saunders' sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly found in regions of South Africa and Namibia. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are characteristic of the sedge family. Waltheria saundersiae is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local biodiversity.
